question: The main objective of scheduling is to maximize ________ usage.
Scheduling aims to minimize ________ time, ensuring no process waits too long.
________ is the total time taken by a process from arrival to completion.
One of the objectives of scheduling is to ensure that every process gets a ________ chance to run.
________ is the number of processes completed per unit time.
In a system, when a process is using the CPU for calculations, it is performing a ________ burst.
When a process is waiting for input or output, it is performing a ________ burst.
A ________ scheduling algorithm ensures that the CPU switches from one process to another before the current process finishes.
In a ________ scheduling algorithm, the CPU does not switch from one process to another until the running process completes its execution.
The ________ algorithm assigns a fixed time slot to each process and cycles through them.
________ Scheduling can be more efficient in resource allocation but may introduce more overhead.
In ________ Scheduling, once a process begins execution, it cannot be interrupted until it finishes.
The ________ Scheduling algorithm executes the process with the shortest remaining time next.
________ Scheduling ensures that the process with the highest priority is executed first.
The ________ Scheduling algorithm executes processes based on their arrival time.
In a ________ Scheduling algorithm, once a process starts, it cannot be preempted by any other process.
The number of completed processes per unit time is known as ________.
The time a process spends waiting in the queue is known as ________ time.
________ is the percentage of time the CPU is busy executing processes.
The time taken from when a request is made until it starts execution is known as ________ time.
In a system, if the CPU is kept busy as much as possible, the system is said to have ________ utilization.
The time taken from the arrival of a process to its completion is known as ________ time.
________ is an important scheduling criterion that refers to the total time spent by a process in the system.
A system that ensures fairness in executing processes is said to have a ________ scheduling strategy.
A process with the ________ execution time is given priority in the Shortest Job Next scheduling algorithm.
________ is a scheduling criterion where the system aims to respond quickly to user actions.
When using ________ Scheduling, a process that arrives first is executed first.
In ________ Scheduling, the CPU executes the process with the highest priority first.
________ scheduling algorithms are considered more flexible because they allow preemption of tasks.
In ________ scheduling, the CPU never switches to another task until the current one finishes.
The scheduling algorithm that assigns the CPU to the process with the shortest remaining time is known as ________.
In ________ Scheduling, each process gets a fixed time slot and is executed in a circular order.
The total time taken for a process to complete from the moment it arrives to its completion is referred to as ________ time.
In ________ Scheduling, the process that arrives first is executed first, without interruption.
________ scheduling is used to allocate CPU time between multiple tasks that have varying priorities.
The ________ algorithm ensures a fair distribution of CPU time among processes.
________ time is the time a process spends in the ready queue, waiting for the CPU to execute it.
A system's ________ aims to ensure that no process is starved of CPU time for too long.
In ________ Scheduling, once the CPU starts executing a process, it cannot be interrupted until completion.
________ Scheduling can cause long waiting times, as processes are not preempted during execution.
In ________ scheduling, the CPU is allocated to the process that is waiting the least amount of time.
In ________ Scheduling, the CPU switches between processes in a circular fashion, giving each a fixed time slice.
One of the criteria for scheduling is to maximize the ________ time of the CPU.
________ is an important scheduling criterion that minimizes the total time spent by a process in the system.
A process that is waiting for I/O tasks to complete is in the ________ burst phase.
The goal of scheduling is to ________ the system's efficiency and performance.
________ Scheduling ensures that no process is interrupted before completing its task.
________ Scheduling is efficient for systems that prioritize fairness and quick responses.
A well-designed scheduling algorithm aims to balance ________ and resource utilization.
The goal of ________ scheduling is to reduce the time processes spend waiting for the CPU.
